page.title: 11Whitley Rose Queen
page.content: Scouts,Brownies and Guides,then the two Rose Queens & their retinues; the school country dance team and the play group trailer, also the entertainers for that year. In April we have a film show of last year's Rose Queen and it shows the Country dances, the new and retiring Queens and their attendants. After the film show we have a 'draw' for the new Queen, who is usually from ll to 16 years and is chosen from the children who live in Whitley parish. The Crown bearer and train bearers are chosen from the younger boys; the attendants are girls from 6 to 9 years. Pre-school children are chosen to present small posies of flowers to the President,the Chairman and their wives. It seems that Rose Queen Fete is a day when everyone comes together and enjoys themselves in, with and for the village of Whitley.
